result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C Story was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution for funeral costs to be paid in full before any supervision fees or other court costs.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked of will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a)

Total court costs to be paid during extended supervision, however, restitution for funeral expenses to be paid first.

The Department to collect $300 for buy money which is to be reimbursed to the Ozaukee County Drug Task Force, Oz Sheriff's Dept.

Absolute sobriety.
No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.
Take all prescribed medications and keep in the original containers.
Random testing.
Any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
No contact with parents of victim or their residence.
No contact with drug dealers.
Maintain full-time employment.
Submit to DNA sample at Ozaukee County Jail.

10:21am Jury excused for break until 10:40am. In session outside the jury's presence.

10:42am In session outside jury's presence. Defendant chooses not to testify, court examines defendant regarding his choice not to testify.

3:47pm In session. Jury brought in with verdict. Court reads verdict of: Guilty. Jury polled, thanked and excused.  State asks for judgment on the verdict. Court grants judgment on the verdict. Pre-sentence investigation ordered and sentencing set over to 7/6/16 at 3:00pm. Defendant remanded into custody until sentencing hearing.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge

Defendant Justin C Story in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests to adjourn prelim hearing, waiving time limits. Counsel will be filing request for substitution of Judge. Court denies request to adjourn prelim hearing. Counsel files request for substitution of Judge. Court finds request is timely and matter to be reassigned.
w/condititions: No alcohol of any kind; no controlled substances; no contact with the Motte family or the Bintzler family

Defendant Justin C Story by video from the Ozaukee Co Jail with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for public defender representation, however it is a conflict with Attorney McClendon's office.  Counsel waives reading of complaint and time limits. Court advises defendant of penalties. State requests $75,000 cash bail with conditions. Defendant is on probation hold and being held on current charges. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
